entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is described as the boy who roared in silent amusement beside Dumbledore.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as having a gleeful, wild look about him and is described as scratching his nose on the front of the book.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is described as wondering whether Ron's appearance was that of a young doge, and later as pulling the Invisibility cloak over himself to avoid being seen by Thicknesse.

entities.name: thicknesse
entities.description: Thicknesse is described as entering the office, looking over his shoulder, and staring curiously at the place where Harry had just vanished.

entities.name: umbridge
entities.description: Umbridge is mentioned as the recipient of a note being written by Thicknesse's quill.

relationships.description: Harry is observed by Thicknesse, who catches a glimpse of movement and remains still for a moment.
Dumbledore is mentioned as being near Harry, with Ron roaring in silent amusement beside them.
